channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-14607] ORC split generation failed with exception: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
item.description:
Steps to repro:
in TestTxnCommands2WithSplitUpdate remove the overridden method testOrcPPD().
Then run:
mvn test -Dtest=TestTxnCommands2WithSplitUpdate#testOrcPPD

it will fail with ArrayIndexOutOfBounds. HIVE-14448 was supposed to have fixed it....

2016-08-22T15:54:17,654  INFO [main] mapreduce.JobSubmitter: Cleaning up the staging area file:/Users/ekoifman/dev/hiverwgit/ql/target/tmp/hadoop-tmp/mapred/staging/ekoifman99742506\

item.summary: ORC split generation failed with exception: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: mmccline, prasanth_j, could one of you take a look a this please?

The query that is failing is "update acidTbl set b = 5 where a = 3"
The issue is that "hive.io.file.readcolumn.names" has value "a"
but in 

getSargColumnNames(String[] originalColumnNames,
      List<OrcProto.Type> types, boolean[] includedColumns, boolean isOriginal)
for(int columnId: types.get(rootColumn).getSubtypesList()) {

has 2 elements in the list ('a', b') so 

originalColumnNames[i++]

gets ArrayIndexOutOfBounds

The reason this is not an issue in Acid 1.0, is that 

if ((deltas == null || deltas.isEmpty()) && context.sarg != null) {

in callInternal() is false and this code path never happens.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12826533/HIVE-14607.01.patch

SUCCESS: +1 due to 1 test(s) being added or modified.

ERROR: -1 due to 6 failed/errored test(s), 10436 tests executed
Failed tests:

TestBeeLineWithArgs - did not produce a TEST-*.xml file
TestHiveCli - did not produce a TEST-*.xml file

ATTACHMENT ID: 12826533 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
Mostly looks good to me. Can you please add a test for this? Any reason to remove one of the test?

Eugene instructed me to remove the @Override method that was disabling the tests that were blowing up. When removed, the problem occurred so I could debugged and verify the fix. So, it has a test and is ready. He has created a whole new paradigm.
actually both testOrcPPD() and testOrcNoPPD() in TestTxnCommands2WithSplitUpdate need to be removed
I should release the parking brake? ok
